docs.title: Freya - Your Modular Assistant
docs.text: Freya is a powerful, modular assistant designed to make your life easier. With Freya, you can install and manage various packages effortlessly, giving you control over your environment and tasks. Freya supports seamless communication with its modules, making it a versatile tool for automation, customization, and expansion.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Easy Installation: Install new modules quickly using freya install <package>.
  • Run Modules Effortlessly: Execute installed modules with a simple freya run.
  • Modular Design: Freya communicates with its modules efficiently, providing a cohesive user experience.
  • Expandable: Add functionality by installing additional packages as needed.
  • Customizable: Build and configure modules to suit your unique requirements.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: Ensure you have the following installed: - Python 3.9+ - pip (Python package manager) -- Docker

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Download the Freya CLI

    pip install freya-cli

that it...

docs.title: Installing a Package
docs.text:
To install a new module, use the freya install command:

freya install <package>

For example:

freya install weather

docs.title: Running a Module
docs.text:
Start Freya using:

freya run

Freya will list available modules for selection.

docs.title: Adding New Modules
docs.text: You can create custom modules for Freya by following these steps: 1. Develop your module and package it according to Freya's module structure. 2. Publish your module or share it locally. 3. Install it using the freya install <package> command.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
1. Installing and Running a Module:

    freya install todo freya run

  2. Checking Installed Modules:

    freya list

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
We welcome ontributions to make Freya even better! To contribute: 1. Fork the repository you want to contribute to. 2. Create a new branch for your feature or bug fix. 3. Commit your changes and submit a pull request.

Please refer to the Contributing page for detailed guidelines.

docs.title: License
docs.text:
This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the License page for details.

--

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
If you have any questions, issues, or feedback, please open an issue in the repository or reach out to support@freyaassistant.com.

--

docs.title: Acknoledgments
docs.text: Freya is inspired by the Norse goddess of love and destiny, aiming to bring clarity and control to your workflows. Thank you for choosing Freya!

docs.title: Added
docs.text: • ✨ New feature added

docs.title: Changed
docs.text: • 🔄 Updated existing functionality

docs.title: Fixed
docs.text: • 🐛 Bug fixes

docs.title: Removed
docs.text: • 🗑️ Deprecated features removed

docs.title: Our Pledge
docs.text:
We as members, contributors, and leaders pledge to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

We pledge to act and interact in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, and healthy community.

docs.title: Our Standards
docs.text:
Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment for our community include:

  • Demonstrating empathy and kindness toward other people
  • Being respectful of differing opinions, viewpoints, and experiences
  • Giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback
  • Accepting responsibility and apologizing to those affected by our mistakes, and learning from the experience
  • Focusing on what is best not just for us as individuals, but for the overall community

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

  • The use of sexualized language or imagery, and sexual attention or advances of any kind
  • Trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
  • Public or private harassment
  • Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or email address, without their explicit permission
  • Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting

docs.title: Enforcement Responsibilities
docs.text:
Community leaders are responsible for clarifying and enforcing our standards of acceptable behavior and will take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any behavior that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.

Community leaders have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, and will communicate reasons for moderation decisions when appropriate.

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This Code of Conduct applies within all community spaces, and also applies when an individual is officially representing the community in public spaces. Examples of representing our community include using an official e-mail address, posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed representative at an online or offline event.

docs.title: Enforcement
docs.text:
Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported to the community leaders responsible for enforcement at . All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.

All community leaders are obligated to respect the privacy and security of the reporter of any incident.

docs.title: Enforcement Guidelines
docs.text: Community leaders will follow these Community Impact Guidelines in determining the consequences for any action they deem in violation of this Code of Conduct:

docs.title: 1. Correction
docs.text:
Community Impact: Use of inappropriate language or other behavior deemed unprofessional or unwelcome in the community.

Consequence: A private, written warning from community leaders, providing clarity around the nature of the violation and an explanation of why the behavior was inappropriate. A public apology may be requested.

docs.title: 2. Warning
docs.text:
Community Impact: A violation through a single incident or series of actions.

Consequence: A warning with consequences for continued behavior. No interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, for a specified period of time. This includes avoiding interactions in community spaces as well as external channels like social media. Violating these terms may lead to a temporary or permanent ban.

docs.title: 3. Temporary Ban
docs.text:
Community Impact: A serious violation of community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior.

Consequence: A temporary ban from any sort of interaction or public communication with the community for a specified period of time. No public or private interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, is allowed during this period. Violating these terms may lead to a permanent ban.

docs.title: 4. Permanent Ban
docs.text:
Community Impact: Demonstrating a pattern of violation of community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment of an individual, or aggression toward or disparagement of classes of individuals.

Consequence: A permanent ban from any sort of public interaction within the community.

docs.title: Attribution
docs.text:
This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html.

Community Impact Guidelines were inspired by Mozilla's code of conduct enforcement ladder.

For answers to common questions about this code of conduct, see the FAQ at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations are available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

docs.title: Contributing to Freya
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing to Freya! I welcome contributions from everyone. Here are some ways you can help:

docs.title: How to Contribute
docs.text: https://github.com/kliiyu-freya

docs.title: Reporting Bugs
docs.text:
• Check the respective issue tracker to see if the bug has already been reported.
  • If not, create a new issue and provide detailed information about the bug.

docs.title: Suggesting Features
docs.text:
• Open a new issue with the "Feature Request" template.
  • Describe the feature and why it would be useful.

docs.title: Submitting Pull Requests
docs.text:
• Fork the respective repository and create a new branch for your feature or bugfix.
  • Make your changes and ensure they pass all tests.
  • Submit a pull request with a clear description of your changes.

docs.title: Improving Documentation
docs.text:
• Check the documentation for areas that need improvement.
  • Submit pull requests with your updates.

docs.title: Code of Conduct
docs.text: Please read and follow our Code of Conduct to ensure a welcoming environment for all contributors.

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text: If you need help, feel free to ask questions in the respective discussion forum.

docs.title: Freya: AI Assistant/Home Assistant
docs.text: Welcome to the guide for installing, running, using, configuring, and troubleshooting Freya. This guide will walk you through every step to get the most out of your AI assistant.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
1. Installation
  2. Running Freya
  3. Configuration
  4. Troubleshooting
  5. FAQ

docs.title: Configuring Freya
docs.text: Configuring Freya allows you to tailor its behavior and settings to your specific needs. The easiest way to configure Freya is through the dashboard.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
1. Accessing the Dashboard
  2. Using the Configuration Panel
  3. Saving and Applying Changes

docs.title: Accessing the Dashboard
docs.text:
To configure Freya, start by accessing the dashboard. Open your browser and navigate to the following URL:

http://localhost:6672

Ensure that Freya is running before attempting to access the dashboard. If the page doesn't load: - Verify that the Freya Dashboard is installed. - Confirm Freya is running with the freya run command.

docs.title: Using the Configuration Panel
docs.text:
Once on the dashboard:

  1. Log In: If required, log in using the credentials set during installation (or the default credentials if not configured yet).

  2. Navigate to Settings: Locate and click on the Settings or Configuration tab in the dashboard menu.

  3. Adjust Settings: Customize the available options, which may include:

  4. General Settings: Modify Freya's name, response behavior, and operational preferences.
  5. Integration Settings: Add or configure third-party integrations such as smart home devices or APIs.

  6. Network Settings: Update connection settings, including ports and hostnames.

  7. Advanced Configuration:

  8. For more advanced users, use the Advanced or Custom Scripts sections to modify Freya's internal behavior or add custom modules.

docs.title: Saving and Applying Changes
docs.text:
After making your changes:

  1. Save Settings: Click the Save or Apply Changes button on the dashboard.

  2. Restart Freya (if prompted): Some changes require a restart to take effect. Use:

    freya run

Continue to the next section to learn how to troubleshoot Freya.

Next: Troubleshooting Freya

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before installing Freya, ensure the following prerequisites are met:

  1. Docker: Freya runs in a Docker container. Install Docker from the official website.
  2. Python: Freya requires Python to be installed. Download and install Python from the official Python website.

docs.title: Steps to Install Freya
docs.text:
1. Install the Freya CLI Open your terminal and run the following command:

    pip install freya-cli

  2. Verify Installation Run the following command to verify that the Freya CLI is installed:

    freya version

    If that doesnt work run: python -m freya version

  3. Install the Freya Core Run the following command to install Freya core:

    freya install core:latest

  4. Optional Install the Freya Dashboard:

    freya install dashboard:latest

  5. Verify Installation Run the following command to verify the installation:

    freya list

Continue to the next section to learn how to run and interact with Freya.

Next Running Freya.

docs.title: Running Freya
docs.text: Once Freya is installed, you can start it using the Freya CLI. This guide provides instructions for running Freya and monitoring its status.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
1. Starting Freya
  2. Accessing the Dashboard
  3. Viewing Logs

docs.title: Starting Freya
docs.text:
To start Freya, use the following command in your terminal:

freya run

This command will launch Freya in your terminal and begin executing the core processes.

docs.title: Troubleshooting the freya run Command
docs.text:
• If freya run doesn't work, try using:

    python -m freya run

  • Ensure the installation step was completed successfully, and verify your Python environment.

docs.title: Accessing the Dashboard
docs.text:
Note: The first time you access the dashboard, you will be prompted to create an account.

If you installed the optional Freya Dashboard, you can access it by navigating to the following URL in your browser:

http://localhost:6672

The dashboard provides an interface to interact with Freya, monitor its performance, and manage configurations.

docs.title: If the Dashboard Is Not Installed
docs.text: If you chose not to install the dashboard, you can still monitor Freya's logs to track its status

docs.title: Viewing Logs
docs.text:
To check Freya's logs, visit the same URL used for the dashboard:

http://localhost:6672

Without the dashboard installed, this URL will serve a log interface that displays real-time updates and output from Freya.

Alternatively, you can view logs directly in your terminal where Freya is running.

Continue to the next section to learn how to configure Freya for your needs.

Next: Configuring Freya

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
docs.text: This document addresses common questions about Freya. If your question isn't answered here, refer to the Troubleshooting Guide or reach out for support.

docs.title: 1. What is Freya?
docs.text: Freya is an AI assistant/home assistant that helps automate tasks, manage smart devices, and provide AI-powered assistance in your daily life.

docs.title: 2. What platforms does Freya support?
docs.text: Freya runs on systems that support Docker and Python, including Windows, macOS, and Linux.

docs.title: 3. Do I need coding skills to use Freya?
docs.text: No, Freya is designed for ease of use with a dashboard for configuration. However, advanced users can customize Freya by modifying its scripts.

docs.title: 4. What are the prerequisites for installing Freya?
docs.text:
You need:

  • Docker for containerized operation.
  • Python for CLI functionality.
  • Optional: Git if cloning the source code.

docs.title: 5. How do I verify that Freya is installed correctly?
docs.text:
Run the following command:

freya -v

docs.title: 6. How do I start Freya?
docs.text:
Use the command:

freya run

If that doesn't work, try:

python -m freya run

docs.title: 7. How do I access the Freya dashboard?
docs.text:
Navigate to:

http://localhost:6672

Make sure Freya is running and the dashboard is installed.

docs.title: 8. Can Freya integrate with smart home devices?
docs.text: Yes, Freya supports integration with various smart devices. You can configure these integrations through the dashboard.

docs.title: 9. How do I configure Freya?
docs.text:
Use the dashboard at:

http://localhost:6672

Navigate to the Settings section to update configurations.

docs.title: 10. What should I do if configuration changes don’t apply?¨
docs.text:
Ensure you click Save or Apply Changes in the dashboard and restart Freya:

freya restart

docs.title: 11. Why is the dashboard not accessible?
docs.text:
• Verify Freya is running:

    freya run

  • Ensure the dashboard and core is installed:

    freya install core:latest
freya install dashboard:latest

docs.title: 12. What should I do if Freya stops working?
docs.text:
• Restart Freya:

    freya restart

  • Check the logs for errors:

    freya logs

docs.title: 13. How do I view Freya's logs?
docs.text:
You can view logs via:

  • Dashboard: At http://localhost:6672
  • CLI:
    freya logs

docs.title: 14. Can I customize Freya's behavior?
docs.text:
Yes, advanced users can modify Freya by:

  • Editing configuration files.
  • Adding custom scripts in the Advanced section of the dashboard.

docs.title: 15. Is Freya open-source?
docs.text: Yes, Freya is licensed under the MIT license Check the licensing and repository information on Freya's GitHub page.

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
If your question isn't answered here:

  • Visit the Troubleshooting Guide.
  • Check Freya's GitHub Discussions.
  • Report issues on Freya's GitHub repository with detailed logs and error descriptions.

Return to the main guide:

  • Installation Guide
  • Running Freya
  • Configuration Guide
  • Troubleshooting Guide

docs.title: Troubleshooting Freya
docs.text: This guide helps you resolve common issues when using Freya. Follow these steps to diagnose and fix problems.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
1. General Troubleshooting Steps
  2. Common Issues and Solutions
  3. Viewing Logs for More Information
  4. Getting Support

docs.title: General Troubleshooting Steps
docs.text:
1. Check if Freya is Running Ensure Freya is active by running:

    freya status

    If it’s not running, start it using:

    freya run

  2. Restart Freya Sometimes, a simple restart resolves issues:

    freya restart

  3. Verify Installation If commands like freya run don't work, confirm Freya is installed correctly:

    freya -v

  4. Ensure Dependencies Are Installed

    • Confirm that Docker is installed and running.

    • Check that the required version of python is installed

      python --version

docs.title: Common Issues and Solutions
docs.text:
1. Cannot Access Dashboard

    • Problem: The dashboard isn't accessible at http://localhost:6672.

    • Solution:

      • Verify that Freya is Runnin:

        freya run

      • Check if the dashboard was installed:

        freya --list packages

      If missing, install it:

      freya --install dashboard:latest

  2. Freya Commands Not Recognized

    • Problem: CLI commands like freya run return an error.

    • Solution:

      • Try running with python -m:

        python -m freya run

      • Ensure Freya CLI is installed:

        pip install freya-cli

  3. Freya Fails to Start

    • Problem: Freya crashes or doesn't start.
    • Solution:
      • Check the logs for detailed error messages (see the Viewing Logs section).

      • Try restrating Freya:

        freya restart

  4. Configuration Changes Not Taking Effect

    • Problem: Updates made in the dashboard don’t seem to apply.
    • Solution:
      • Ensure you clicked Save or Apply Changes.

      • Restart Freya after making configuration updates:

        freya restart

  5. Network or Connection Issues

    • Problem: Freya can't connect to external services or devices.
    • Solution:
      • Check your network settings in the dashboard or configuration files.
      • Verify your internet connection.

docs.title: Viewing Logs for More Information
docs.text:
Logs are essential for diagnosing issues. To view Freya’s logs:

  1. Using the Dashboard: If installed, visit the log interface at:

    http://localhost:6672

  2. Using the Terminal Run:

    freya logs

    Alternatively, check docker desktop for logs

docs.title: Getting Support
docs.text:
If the above steps don’t resolve your issue:

  1. Search the Documentation Refer to the official documentation or FAQ for solutions.

  2. Community Support Post your issue on Freya’s community forum or GitHub Discussions.

  3. Report a Bug Open an issue on Freya’s GitHub repository. Include:

    • A clear description of the problem.
    • Steps to reproduce the issue.
    • Logs or screenshots if applicable.

Return to the main guide or revisit earlier sections:

  • Installation Guide
  • Running Freya
  • Configuration Guide

Next: FAQ
